transcript.text: When we are in a position of market dominance, we must be careful about our actions to avoid legal risk or damage to our reputation. Click on each reveal button to learn more.

contentText.text: If we hold a dominant position in a particular market we need to avoid actions that could be considered an abuse of that position.

instructionText.text: Click on each reveal button to learn more. You may need to scroll to read the full answer.

flipCard.buttonText: Johnson Controls might hold a dominant position in some markets

popText.text: Johnson Controls is a large, global corporation, and in some locations we are the dominant company in our industry.

If we are the biggest player in a market, people may have no other option but to buy from us. We need to be careful in our actions and words in such circumstances to avoid being accused of predatory practices.

flipCard.buttonText: Competition laws prohibit the abuse of a dominant position

popText.text: A dominant position exists when a company has the power to behave "independently" of its customers, competitors and suppliers.
Abuse of dominance can happen when customers have no realistic alternative but to deal with the dominant company.

flipCard.buttonText: Recognize some actions may be risky

popText.text: When we are in a position of market dominance, we must be careful about reputational damage and aware of actions that can carry legal risk under competition laws.
So, for example, we have to avoid charging unreasonably high prices or depriving smaller competitors of customers by selling at artificially low prices they can’t compete with.
Determining market dominance and what to do about it is a complex matter. If you are ever in doubt, consult the Johnson Controls Law or Compliance team for guidance.
